intro: Psychotria viridiflora var. undulata, commonly known as the undulating green-flowered psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its strikingly green, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
